SENT.plain: An infant with a Sturge-Weber variant syndrome developed progressive megalencephaly and eventual hydrocephalus, which required shunting
Cerebral angiography revealed absence of the deep cerebral venous system and the development of abnormal drainage channels via the periorbital veins
It is postulated that the abnormal enlargement of the brain was due to the impaired venous return
Resistance of the brain to continued expansion may have caused an increase in hydrostatic pressure and the development of hydrocephalus
